results.title: Peace in action
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Peace is everyone’s responsibility. The peace program views peace issues being developed and taught in schools. Examples from primary and postprimary schools include art, student initiatives, plays, student councils and community interest. Professor Charlesworth raises issues for further discussion in schools

results.title: Computers in accounting
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, George Cass and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Shows some of the ways in which computer technology is being used in accounting firms and examines the impact of this on small business. Some of the problems encountered by small business when installing a new computer system are discussed. Also looks at the training needed by young people seeking employment in the accounting profession.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, George Cass and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.description: Shows some of the ways in which computer technology is being used in accounting firms and examines the impact of this on small business. Some of the problems encountered by small business when installing a new computer system are discussed. Also looks at the training needed by young people seeking employment in the accounting profession.

results.title: Getting your act together!
results.creator_credit: Sue Johnston and Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology. Communication Services Unit. Television Studios
results.brief_description: Feeling lost and alone on a large tertiary campus is not an uncommon feeling among new students. Students talk about their expectations, and experiences of tertiary education. Advice is given on finance, housing, study skills and personal support.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sue Johnston and Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology. Communication Services Unit. Television Studios

results.title: Growing curriculum partnership. Parts I-IV
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Current trends in Victorian schools call for increased participation and a sharing of resposibilities by parents, students and teachers. These programs are part of a series which set out to highlight certain aspects of this increased participation.

results.title: A Look inside
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Shows different aspects of work inside the Australian National Animal Health Laboratory. After a brief introduction to the importance of the livestock industry and the effects of disease, viewers are taken inside the laboratory to see some of the microbiological features.

results.title: Sexual harassment in schools
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: This program looks at some examples of sexual harassment in a school setting. Focuses on the consequences of harassing behaviour and avenues available to people who wish to take action to prevent it continuing. Ways of dealing with such incidences are suggested and legal rights under the Equal Opportunity Act 1984 are explained.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Ministry of Education

results.title: What's for lunch?
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris, Rob McCubbin, Trevor Lunn and Channel 7 for Curriculum Branch, Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Panel discussion about nutrition in schools including scenes from actual classrooms, where panelists Phillip Hughes and Anne Keogh discuss a good food “Pyramid” with children at a Victorian primary school.

results.title: Bicycles down the years
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: An introduction to the history of the bicycle, looking at some of the technical and social changes in the past one hundred and twenty years. Bill Sidebottom and Doug McCann from Museum of Victoria present a collection of vintage and veteran bicycles to tell the story.

results.title: Keeping animals in the classroom
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and Curriculum Branch, Ministry of Education for Zoo Education Service
results.brief_description: Trevor Lunn introduces Karen Svalesen from the Zoo Education Service who examines the problems that can be encountered when keeping animals in the classroom. Suggests suitable animals and information sources to assist with animal care.
